meanings.definition: To prevail over; to dominate or control
meanings.sent1: In the game, teamwork often overrides individual skill.
meanings.sent2: The new law overrides the old regulations.
meanings.sent3: The cat overrides the dog's attempts to steal its food.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter overrides any sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright sunlight overrides the darkness of the night.

meanings.sent1: The judge overrides the objection raised by the defense lawyer.
meanings.sent2: The manager can override the decision made by the team.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could override my alarm clock in the morning.
meanings.sent4: His charisma can override any doubts people may have.
meanings.sent5: The storm's power can override any man-made structures.

meanings.definition: A device or system that takes precedence over another
meanings.sent1: The emergency shutdown button is an important override in the factory.
meanings.sent2: The software update includes a new override feature.
meanings.sent3: The override in the car prevented the engine from starting.
meanings.sent4: The master key acts as an override for all the locks in the building.
meanings.sent5: The president's veto serves as an override to stop a bill from becoming law.
